Description: Limestone ostracon: on both recto and verso nine lines of a text containing parts of a necropolis journal, recording deliveries of pigments, failure to receive rations and other matters. In line 6 of the verso the tomb of Ramses VII is mentioned.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Biban el-Muluk (Valley of the Kings - Thebes)
Curator's comments: The ostracon is completed at the upper right by a fragment in the Cairo Museum, O. Cairo 25649. Bibliography: S. Birch, 'Inscriptions in the Hieratic and Demotic Character, from the Collections of the British Museum' (London 1868), pl. XXIII; J. J. Černy and A.H. Gardiner, ‘Hieratic Ostraca’ (Oxford 1957), p. 20 and pl. LXIX, 1; K. Kitchen, 'Ramesside Inscriptions' Vl (Oxford 1983), 660-61.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (136362) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/136362)
Associated places: Named in inscription: Tomb of Ramses VII
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
